note.note-paragraph: In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

title-part.text: Machines for printing and issuing tickets

reference.text: printing mechanisms per se B41; output mechanisms of digital computers G06C11/00

title-part.text: from stock in wound strip form
Details of, or auxiliary devices for, ticket-issuing machines
for recording or registering tickets issued
for avoiding incorrect action of the machine
indicating when ticket supply is exhausted
allowing manual writing on the tickets
Holders providing direct manual access to the tickets

reference.text: perforating pliers B26F1/36; marking record carriers in digital fashion by punching G06K1/02

title-part.text: Apparatus for validating or cancelling issued tickets
combined with receptacle for separated part of ticket

reference.text: measuring distance travelled G01C; measuring time G04

title-part.text: for indicating fare or state of hire

CPC-specific-text.text: with indicating means on the outside of the vehicle

title-part.text: Arrangements or apparatus for collecting fares, tolls or entrance fees at one or more control points

reference.text: handling coins or valuable papers, e.g. banknotes, G07D; apparatus for vending or hiring articles or services activated by coins, credit cards, paper currency or the like G07F7/00, G07F17/00

note.note-paragraph: Data processing aspects of payment systems or protocols relating to toll, entrance fee or fare collection, e.g. in road pricing or congestion charging, are also classified in G06Q20/00.

note-paragraph.CPC-specific-note: This group covers also: car rental systems; systems for reserving and using access tickets, e.g. check-in systems

title-part.text: taking into account a variable factor such as distance or time, e.g. for passenger transport, parking systems or car rental systems

reference.text: G07B15/06 takes precedence; taximeters G07B13/00; parking meters per se G07F17/24;

CPC-specific-text.text: car rental systems per se G07B15/00

title-part.text: comprising devices to free a barrier, turnstile, or the like

reference.text: turnstiles with registering means G07C9/10; coin-freed aspects G07F17/00

title-part.text: Arrangements for road pricing or congestion charging of vehicles or vehicle users, e.g. automatic toll systems

note.note-paragraph: This group covers the identification or tracking of vehicles or vehicle users for the purpose of road pricing or congestion charging, which means that vehicles or vehicle users are not necessarily channelled through fixed control points, e.g. toll booths or overhead gantries, but may be detected at a number of places when they travel in normal fashion in a pre-defined locality, e.g. a defined area in a city centre or an expressway, and where the information so generated is then used to determine a charge to be paid

CPC-specific-text.text: using wireless information transmission between the vehicle and a fixed station
operated by portable carriers, e.g. for inputting credit or information
Relations between apparatus, e.g. franking machine at customer or apparatus at post office, in a franking system
Physical or organizational aspects of franking systems
Determining the location of mailpieces outside apparatus
Virtual meter, online stamp; PSD functions or indicia creation not at user's location
Hybrid mail, i.e. mail delivered using different physical means along the mail delivery path, e.g. email and envelope
Communication details outside or between apparatus

reference.text: coin-freed apparatus for franking per se G07F17/26

CPC-specific-text.text: from a central, non-user location, e.g. for updating rates or software, or for refilling funds
from a franking apparatus, e.g. for verifying accounting
from a portable device, e.g. a card or a PCMCIA
Details internally of apparatus in a franking system, e.g. franking machine at customer or apparatus at post office

reference.text: digital data processing G06F; coin-freed apparatus for franking per se G07F17/26

CPC-specific-text.text: Constructional details of apparatus in a franking system
Open franking system, i.e. the printer is not dedicated to franking only, e.g. PC (Personal Computer)
Mailbox, i.e. container for outgoing mail
Portable franking apparatus, i.e. the whole franking apparatus, not parts alone
Vending machine or POS (Point Of Sale) apparatus
Housing, e.g. lock or hardened casing
Electronic hardware aspects, e.g. type of circuits used
Soft buttons; buttons that can change function
Visual, e.g. screens and their layouts
Acoustic, e.g. voice control or speech prompting
Communication within apparatus, personal computer [PC] system, or server, e.g. between printhead and central unit in a franking machine
Communication between components/modules/parts, e.g. printer, printhead, keyboard, conveyor or central unit
Communication with software component, e.g. dll or object
Calculation or computing within apparatus, e.g. calculation of postage value
Calculation of different sending options for a mail piece
Currency calculation, e.g. from DEM to EUR
Memory zones protected from unauthorized reading or writing
Redundant storage, e.g. back-up of registers
Software organization, e.g. separation into objects
Special accounting procedures, e.g. storing special information
Details specific to central, non-customer apparatus, e.g. servers at post office or vendor
Verification of mailpieces, e.g. by checking databases
Address hygiene, i.e. checking and correcting addresses to be printed on mail pieces using address databases
Details relating to mailpieces in a franking system
Measures for preventing or handling mailpieces stoppages

reference.text: printing mechanisms B41J; security printing B41M3/14; marking methods B41M5/00; inks C09D11/00; record carriers with at least a part designed to carry digital markings G06K19/00

CPC-specific-text.text: Ensuring correct position of print on mailpiece
Separating print into fixed and variable parts

reference.text: weighing G01G19/00; methods or arrangements for reading or recognising printed or written characters or for recognising patterns G06K9/00

CPC-specific-text.text: Keeping track of mailpieces inside apparatus
Measuring the speed of mailpieces inside apparatus
Cryptography or similar special procedures in a franking system

note.note-paragraph: References listed below indicate CPC places which could also be of interest when carrying out a search in respect of the subject matter covered by the preceding group: secret or secure communication H04L9/00mechanisms actuated by objects other thancoins to free or to actuate vending, hiring, coin or paper currency dispensing or refunding apparatus for cashless transactions only G07F7/10access-control involving the use of a pass in combination with an identity-check of the pass- holder by means of personal physical data, e.g. characteristic facial curves, hand geometry, voice spectrum, fingerprints G07C9/00methods or arrangements for reading or recognising printed or written characters or for recognising patterns G06K9/00random or pseudo-random generators G06F7/58circuits generating pulses having a predetermined statistical distribution H03K3/84multiple service credit cards with protecting memory zones G07F7/10security arrangements for protecting computers or computer systems against unauthorised activity G06F21/00record carriers with conductive marks and special arrangements for circuits, e.g. for protecting identification code in memory G06K19/073error detection and error correction G06F11/00coding, decoding or code conversion, for error detection or error correction H03M13/00

CPC-specific-text.text: using specific cryptographic algorithms or functions
Symmetric, secret-key algorithms, e.g. DES, RC2, RC4, IDEA, Skipjack, CAST, AES
Asymmetric, public-key algorithms, e.g. RSA, Elgamal
Digital signature, e.g. DSA, DSS, ECDSA, ESIGN
Hash function, e.g. MD5, MD2, SHA
using timestamps, i.e. recording time in message
Continuous communication, e.g. answer within a limited time period
Postal data, e.g. postage, address, sender, machine ID, vendor
Key storage, e.g. escrowing by trusted third party
using look-up tables, also called master tables with pointers
Key verification, e.g. by using trusted party
Error handling, e.g. EDC (Error Detection Codes)
Cryptographic modules, e.g. a PC encryption board
PSD [Postal Security Device] as defined by the USPS [US Postal Service]
with means for resetting the monetary value of the accounting means
from a central point, e.g. post office

title-part.text: with means for computing or counting
